First, install some customized themes from github. For example, [here](https://github.com/lusignan/RStudio-Material-Theme).

Then, copy one .rstheme file from \~/.config/rstudio/themes to your customized file.

``` bash
➜  rstudio ls
dictionaries       rstudio-prefs.json themes
➜  rstudio ls   
dictionaries       rstudio-prefs.json themes
➜  rstudio cd themes 
➜  themes ls
material-lighter.rstheme   material-palenight.rstheme material.rstheme
➜  themes cp material.rstheme material.rstheme              
cp: material.rstheme and material.rstheme are identical (not copied).
➜  themes cp material.rstheme jihongMaterial.rstheme
➜  themes code jihongMaterial.rstheme        
```

Open the `.rstheme` file, add the following code:

``` {.css filename="jihongMaterial.rstheme"}
.pm-proportional-font {
  font-family: "American Typewriter", serif !important;
  font-size: 14pt !important;
}
```

Change the font family in the according quote.

Here is the my customized file: [jihongMaterial.rstheme](./jihongMaterial.rstheme)

Note:

-   Please look over the [website](https://docs.posit.co/ide/user/ide/guide/ui/appearance.html) for more details.
